channel.title: Blog on Thoughts by Liz Carey
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Thoughts by Liz Carey

item.title: 2018 Recap: Books I Read
item.description: Books I read in 2018 This year, I read x number of books. Below is a rank order of my preferred Less (Winner of the Pulitzer Prize): A Novel By Andrew Sean Greer ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ How to Change Your Mind By Michael Pollan Call Me by Your Name: A Novel By André Aciman Sourdough: A novel By Robin Sloan But What if We’re Wrong?: Thinking About the Present As If it Were the Past

item.title: Reflecting on Christmas dinner
item.description: A sign of getting older is when visiting home for the holidays is more stressful than not. With every year that passes, a responsibility gets added to my plate. And with this year, both the metaphorical and literal plate as preparing Christmas dinner became one of the layered responsibilities. And like all great heroes, I didn’t ask for this responsibility; it was simply bestowed upon me against my will.

item.title: Starting a blog
item.description: I finally started a blog! I first thought about starting a blog 3 years ago. I never went through it because: I didn’t know where to begin I couldn’t think of any content Laziness The trick is to set aside a few hours and commit. If you’re familiar with R, the only resource you need is Yihui Xie’s blogdown book. Key tips that helped me publish this blog:
